post.body: Hello ZeroMe!
stop expecting everybody to treat you better than you treat yourself
if you don’t stand for something, you fall for anything.

most people are not people.
they are products, assembling products.

you can be a software engineer w/o working for a corporation. the two aren’t related. a corporation is a hierarchy, which is designed to create inequality. forget made up ranks. be free. create your own software. leave the military-style corporate hierarchy rank system behind.
ladies, start dating shorter man. establish your superiority. start building the matriarchy today. #equality

what is the best example how dumb humans are?

believing in an all-knowing man in the sky (god), that somehow zapped us into existence and demands we follow the rules of a book written thousands of years ago by humans

but shaming and making fun of children who believe in santa claus beyond a certain age because it’s silly and “obviously made up”.
“There’s a myth that time is money. In fact, time is more precious than money. It’s a nonrenewable resource. Once you’ve spent it, and if you’ve spent it badly, it’s gone forever.” - Neil A. Fiore
“There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.” - Christopher Morley
“somewhere in the forest jungle is a tree tirelessly producing oxygen for you to breathe. i think you own an apology to that tree.”

I must work hard in order to pay back the student debt.

I must work harder to keep my job and get that promotion.

I was easily scammed by the academia-corporate complex into economical-ideological slavery in order to become a gender-neutral obedient productive worker who is skilled enough to do the job but not smart enough to think outside of the box.

we should address the elephant in the room:

smart privilege!

smart people are out-earn dumb people by a factor of 10x-100x-1000x. it's also well known that smart people are often exploited dumb people historically, and smart people are still keep exploiting dumb people now.

tech corporations are exclusively hiring people with smart privileges, and they often reject dumb candidates who don't have a smart privilege.

is it okay to let people who born with smart privilege to have it all and oppress dumb people with their intelligence?

shouldn't we set up a committee to fight until we achieve 50-50% representation of smart and dumb people at every teams in every corporations? shouldn't we setup dumb quotas to enforce corporations to hire dumb people too? #equality

if toxic masculinity exists as an inherent male trait, that would mean that there is an inherent biological difference between the sexes, and gender is not entirely just a social construct as feminists claim... it's either or, can't have it both ways.
feminism = equality with the top 1% ignoring the 99%
just because you're offended it doesn't means you're right

the system is actually quite adaptive, otherwise it would not exists. rigid systems (such as centralized, hierarchical models) are way more fragile.

even if capitalism is technically techno-feudalism, due to its relative distributed nature, its more resilient than any other known models.

in other words, its constantly self-correcting itself. "fixing" is a subjective term, biased by the lens of the ideology we are looking through.
to ask if evolution is true, then why we still have monkeys is like to ask if people can be wealthy then why poor people still exists.
privilege self-shaming is really just humblebragging that you think you are better, and to constantly remind others where is their inherent place in life.

employing h1b slave workers is a $10 billion cost annually.
corporations’ best interest is to keep this cost low.
under the new proposed h1b rules, this cost could double.
no wonder, big tech is attacking the trump administration.
